In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyymm"), df[:dt])
end
```
In this function, `map` applies a function to all elements in an array (in our case, the column `:dt`). The function we're applying is `Dates.format(x, "yyyymm")`, which formats a DateTime as a string in the format "yyyymm".

This new column `df[:ym]` will be of type String, representing each date in "yyyymm" format.
